poem:
### Farewell to Irene

A gold embrace,  
thirty-two years  
in the salt and sun—  
Irene's laughter, woven  
into the fabric of home.  
Departure, a gentle wave,  
as McGranger steps down,  
her stories lingering  
like echoes in evening air,  
a matriarch's heart resting  
on Australian shores,  
fading softly,  
not forgotten.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Logies 2025: Home and Away’s Lynne McGranger wins gold as Fisk dominates Australia’s TV awards The Home and Away actor Lynne McGranger has won the Gold Logie award for most popular personality on Australian television as she ends her record 32-year run playing the much-loved matriarch Irene Roberts. McGranger is the longest-serving female actor in any Australian drama, having played Irene for nearly 33 years. She announced her departure in February and her final episode". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
